folder: Smith Street & State Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Smith Street, east side, between State Street and Atlantic Ave., looking eastward down the center of the block, showing the Williamsburg Savings Bank in the background.

June 1, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Smith Street - State Street: Smith Street, east side, between State Street and Atlantic Avenue, looking eastward down the center of the block, showing the Williamsburg Savings Bank in the background.

folder: State Street & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) State Street, north side, just west of Smith Street, showing the rear of the Old County Court House.

June 1, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing also the site for the new Central Courts Building, subsequently erected, which has since 1931, housed the County, Municipal and City Courts.

June 1, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: State Street & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:

folder: State Street & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
text: (1) State Street, at the N.W. corner of Smith Street, showing site for the new Central Courts Building to be erected. October 5, 1929. P. L. Sperr.  (2) The same; showing the new Central Courts Building. This view of its Smith Street side and its rear was taken from State Street. April 13, 1931. P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: State Street - Smith Street: Left: State Street, at the N.W. corner of Smith Street, showing site for the new Central Courts Building to be erected, October 5, 1929.Right: State Street, at the N.W. corner of Smith Street, showing the new Central Courts Building. This view of its Smith Street side and its rear was taken from State Street, April 13, 1931.

folder: State Street & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
State Street, south side, between Smith and Hoyt Streets.

June 1, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: State Street - Smith Street: State Street, south side, between Smith and Hoyt Streets.

folder: Smith Street & State Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Smith Street, east side, north from State Street to Fulton Street, and its B.M.T. Elevated Lines.

April 7, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: State Street & Smith Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
State Street, west from Smith Street. In the foreground are W. P. A. men working on a sewer project.

March 7, 1936

Works Progress Administration
Five Boroughs Project
